title: Israelis rally again to protest government’s judicial overhaul
description: Tens of thousands rally for the ninth straight week against government plan to overhaul court system.

title: UN nuclear chief says Iran pledges more access for inspectors
description: Iran agrees to reconnect surveillance cameras at nuclear sites and increase pace of inspections, nuclear watchdog says.

title: How to protect the high seas?
description: The world's ocean are being threatened by issues ranging overfishing to deep-sea mining.

title: Schoolgirls in Iran hospitalised after suspected poisonings
description: Dozens of schoolgirls admitted to hospital across several Iranian provinces, according to local media reports.

title: DR Congo leader urges Macron to back sanctions against Rwanda
description: Macron says he would wait for the end of several peace negotiation efforts before considering such a step.

title: Civilians flee Ukraine’s Bakhmut as battle rages for eastern city
description: Kyiv's forces try to help residents escape as Russian fighters press to capture city in eastern Ukraine.

title: Why Ukraine is wary of the Russian opposition
description: Ukrainians have many reasons to distrust Navalny and his movement.

title: China parliament to vote on state reform plan, new cabinet
description: Xi Jinping is expected to secure his third five-year term as president during the National People's Congress (NPC).

title: Hundreds evacuated as Pertamina fire kills at least 17 in Jakarta
description: Probe continues to find out the cause of the fire, but the energy company says a pipe leak was detected before the fire.

title: IAEA head Grossi visits Iran for nuclear talks
description: Nuclear watchdog head Rafael Grossi said the talks could help restore the nuclear deal between Iran and the West.

title: Trade union protests against Tunisia president after crackdown
description: UGTT Secretary-General Noureddine Taboubi expressed support for jailed politicians and activists.

title: Sub-Saharan Africans desperate to leave Tunisia after attacks
description: Advocacy groups have documented an increase in attacks against sub-Saharan Africans in Tunisia.

title: Negros Oriental governor, five others shot dead in Philippines
description: Negros Oriental Governor Degamo is the latest to be targeted in the Philippines' long history of attacks on politicians.

title: Hate speech and pogroms in the West Bank
description: Fire, violence and exultant settlers - Israel's occupation gets darker. Plus, journalism in crisis in Pakistan.

title: UN chief condemns rich countries’ ‘vicious’ tactics against poor
description: Guterres says wealthy nations should provide $500bn annually to help others 'trapped in vicious cycles'.

title: Cambodia gov’t rejects concern over opposition leader’s sentence
description: Opposition leader Kem Sokha, 69, was sentenced to 27 years on charges of treason and is currently under house arrest.

title: Greek station master due in court over rail disaster
description: Station master faces life imprisonment if found guilty of negligent homicide after train crash killed at least 57.

title: Severe storms in southern US kill at least nine people
description: Deadly storms generating snow and tornadoes roll through southern states and move towards the northeastern US.

title: Can the EU go all electric and ban fossil fuel cars in 12 years?
description: The European Union plans to halt fossil fuel car sales by 2035 and wants to speed up the switch to electric vehicles.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 374
description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 374th day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: Women drivers race to break Formula 1’s male monopoly
description: With nearly half of Formula 1 fans now female, new initiatives aim to get women into the driving seat.

title: Hong Kong court convicts 3 members of 1989 Tiananmen vigil group
description: Court convicted Hong Kong democracy activist and barrister Chow Hang-tung, as well as Tang Ngok Kwan and Tsui Hon Kwong.

title: WHO urges countries to reveal intelligence on COVID-19 origins
description: WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus says 'all hypotheses on the origins of the virus remain on the table'.

title: US President Biden had cancerous skin lesion removed successfully
description: Biden's doctor has given the 80-year-old a clean bill of health after 'all cancerous tissue was successfully removed'.

title: State of emergency declared as two cyclones hit Vanuatu in 24 hrs
description: Hundreds of thousands of people are estimated to be affected after two Category 4 cyclones hit Vanuatu in 24 hours.

title: Hostages freed amid deadly energy company protests in Colombia
description: Eighty-eight officers and employees have been released after violence broke out against the oil company Emerald Energy.

title: Biden, Scholz pledge to punish Russia over Ukraine war
description: An EU official also said China providing arms to Russia would be an 'absolute red line' and lead to sanctions: Report
